p: Thus, obesity appears to be a risk factor for presenting a severe form of COVID-19. It should be mentioned that once in ICU, obesity is known to confer a survival advantage, termed the “obesity paradox” ( 54). Patients with a BMI > 25 kg/m 2 seem to survive mechanical ventilation and severe septic states significantly better than patients with a normal or low BMI ( 55, 56), presumably due to their elevated muscle mass, which represents a metabolic reserve in the hypermetabolic state of ICU patients ( 54, 57). It is not yet known whether once admitted to ICU, obese COVID-19 patients also present a better prognosis than patients of normal body weight.
